titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: Deborah Norris Logan (1761-1839) was an eminent Philadelphian. She was the daughter of Charles and Mary Parker Norris and the granddaughter of Isaac Norris. In 1781, she married Dr. George Logan, a physician, farmer, and statesman. In 1814, Deborah Norris Logan started work copying and annotating the Penn-Logan Correspondence. She also wrote a memoir of her husband's life, which was published by the Historical Society of Pennsylvania well after Logan's death. In addition to these works, and her diaries, she continued to write articles and poetry into her seventies. Deborah Norris Logan was a Quaker throughout her life. Her husband, Dr. George Logan, was a Quaker until disowned in 1791.

scopecontent.p: This is a miscellaneous collection of items belonging to Deborah Norris Logan. Materials include a commonplace book/diary, largely concerned with family history and genealogy; loose diary entries from November-December, 1838; a manuscript copy of her obituary for The Friend; a fragment of a biographical sketch of George Logan; and a manuscript copy of Memoir of Dr. George Logan.

accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is restricted; please contact the holding institution for details.

relatedmaterial.p: Related material may be found in the following collections: Historical Society of Pennsylvania: Deborah Norris Logan diaries (0380).
